description: The recorded sex and gender is to be used to differentiate existing sex or gender data. This element is used for existing 'sex' or 'gender' elements in a document or record when the intent and meaning is unclear. For example, the individual's birth certificate information, passport information, and national identity document information may all be present. This is necessary because an individual's documents may be updated at different rates or for different reasons. Sex assigned at birth (SAAB), while very common and considered essential in some jurisdictions, is considered a recorded sex and gender entry.

element.definition: A sex or gender property for the individual from a document or other record
element.short: A recorded sex or gender property for the individual

element.definition: A sex or gender property for the individual from a document or other record
element.short: The recorded sex or gender property for the individual

element.definition: An international representation of the value found on the document for interoperability and international legal purposes.
element.short: An international representation of the value found on the document

element.comment: For example, if a driver's license is scanned, this property may reference that scanned document.
element.definition: The source document where this sex or gender property is initially recorded.
element.short: The source document where this sex or gender property is initially recorded.

element.definition: The date/time when the sex or gender value was first recorded in the system.
element.short: When the sex or gender value was recorded.

element.definition: The time period during which the recorded sex or gender value applies to the individual
element.short: When the recorded sex or gender value applies

element.comment: For example, if a driver's license is scanned, this property may reference that scanned document.
element.definition: The source document where this sex or gender property is initially recorded.
element.short: The document the sex or gender property was acquired from.

element.comment: For example, a individual's driver's license or passport would be issued by a specific state or country.
element.definition: The jurisdiction or organization that issued the document from which the sex or gender was aquired
element.short: Who issued the document where the sex or gender was aquired

element.definition: Further explanation about the context or source of the recorded sex or gender value
element.short: Context or source information about the recorded sex or gender

name: recordedSexOrGender
